snippet: The F.B.I. needs to be held to a higher standard when reporting on criminal histories in work-related background checks.
abstract: Editorial welcomes Federal Trade Commission's intensified scrutiny of companies that provide criminal background checks used by most firms and corporations to screen job applicants; urges Congress to focus on flawed practices of the Federal Bureau of Investigation, which have produced background check data that has unfairly damaged the prospects of people seeking work.
lead_paragraph: The F.B.I. needs to be held to a higher standard when reporting on criminal histories in work-related background checks.
